response_parsed.title: Implementing Serverless Handlers Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to create and deploy serverless functions using FastAPI, a modern web framework for building APIs in Python 3.12+.
key_points: FastAPI provides an easy-to-use, high-performance, web framework for building APIs.
To create serverless handlers, you will need to use AWS Lambda with FastAPI and the AWS SDK for Python (Boto3).
Use the `FastAPI` and `Uvicorn` libraries for your application and the `boto3` library for handling AWS services.
Your serverless function can be triggered by various events like HTTP requests, message queues, etc.
By utilizing FastAPI's built-in features, you will create clean, well-documented APIs with fast performance and minimal code.
version_notes: This guide is specific to Python 3.12+ and FastAPI version 0.67.0.
Make sure your AWS Lambda runtime matches the supported Python version (e.g., python3.8 or python3.9).
caveats: You need to have an active AWS account and necessary permissions for creating and deploying serverless functions.
To deploy your FastAPI application as a Lambda function, you will need to package it as a zip file or a Docker container.
